questions.question: What is HTML?
questions.answer: HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language and is used to create web pages.

questions.question: How do I change the style of my webpage?
questions.answer: You can use CSS to style your webpage by changing elements like color, size, and layout.

content.text: React is a popular JavaScript library for building user interfaces, particularly for single-page applications. React allows developers to build encapsulated components that manage their state and render efficiently.
JSX is a syntax extension to JavaScript and is used in React to describe the UI. It looks similar to HTML but allows you to use JavaScript expressions within it.
Components are the building blocks of a React application. They can be functional or class-based. Below is an example of a functional component.

questions.question: What is JSX?
questions.answer: JSX is a syntax extension for JavaScript that allows writing HTML-like code within React components.

questions.question: What are components in React?
questions.answer: Components are reusable, encapsulated UI elements that make up a React application.

content.text: Node.js is a JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 JavaScript engine. It allows you to build server-side and network applications using JavaScript.
To get started with Node.js, you need to install it from the official Node.js website. Once installed, you can run JavaScript code from the command line.
Node.js has a rich ecosystem of modules that you can import into your applications. Here's an example of how to use the 'fs' module to read a file.

questions.question: What is Node.js?
questions.answer: Node.js is a JavaScript runtime built on the V8 JavaScript engine, used to build server-side applications.

questions.question: How do I install Node.js?
questions.answer: You can download and install Node.js from the official website. Once installed, you can use 'node --version' to verify the installation.
